message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and text classification. Additionally, the use of convolutional neural networks and deep learning models further supports this categorization. 

It could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper deals with automated deception detection, which is a subfield of AI. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category as the paper discusses the use of deep learning models for fake news detection. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also a possible sub-category as the paper deals with fact-checking and the retrieval of relevant information from source documents. 

Finally, cs.CY (Computers and Society) is a possible sub-category as the paper discusses the real-world political and social impacts of fake news and the need for effective detection methods.
